TopicTitle: [1.5.1] Engine Lighting (1.5.1) Little Config Update (13 October)

Articles.Content:
Released a version with updated configs, but no rebuild. It should work alright, but can't test it (My GPU has not worked since a few weeks ago ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(") ).

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-13T21:12:55Z" title="10/13/2017 09:12  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 13, 2017</time> by tajampi**
Yay!  Good luck getting your GPU replaced.  I haven't yet updated my game to 1.3.1 but I've been sorely missing this in 1.3.0.

I have found an incompatibility, when this mod is installed with the new Engine Ignitor it makes Engine Ignitor stop working.   

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed4019355555" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/168424-131-engine-ignitor-re-ignited-beta/&tab=comments&do=embed&comment=3252198&embedComment=3252198&embedDo=findComment#comment-3252198" style="height:267px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

I still trying to figure out how/why...
The <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> metadata says it only supports 1.2.2.  Shouldn't be hard to fix.
Why do monoprop engines emit light?

yeah my bad.  been taking care of the little one throwing up all night, i dunno where my brain is at.  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
any chance this could be updated for latest version of ksp i do not know how to update

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, stuff said:
> 
> 
> any chance this could be updated for latest version of ksp i do not know how to update
> 

Two points:

1. You shouldn't come on to threads asking for mods to be updated - it's considered poor etiquette, and you'll likely be ignored or shot down (often less politely than this).

2. Before asking, you could try it yourself to see if it works or not. I just did a very quick test, and it seems to work just fine in 1.4.1, at least for the stock Kerbal 1 rocket.

I have tried an example craft with this mod for 1.4.1 (no MH DLC) and did not see it working. If anyone else wants to trial it and make sure I didn't try something wrong--much appreciated. Otherwise I will patiently await an update.

I'm kind of disapointed with the nerv plumes, thoug :( , so i think if this persists ill only use EL.

Thanks in advance :D

basic testing with a Hammer <abbr title="Solid fuel Rocket Booster">SRB</abbr> and Reliant <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O engine show lighting effects are happening. Still, did [@linuxgurugamer](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/129964-linuxgurugamer/) never pick this one up as well? Hey sorry but I'm a bit confused.  Coming back to KSP after a decent size break.  I'm currently building a modded game on 1.4.3 because...reasons.

Can someone point me to the right version of Engine Lighting that works on 1.4.3?  I see 1.4.5 Real Fuels, 1.5, and some other version....

Thanks in advance.

[https://spacedock.info/mod/272/Engine Lighting](https://spacedock.info/mod/272/Engine%20Lighting)

Check the changelog tab -- it shows mod versions along with KSP-appropriate versions. <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> can do this, too if enough mod versions are tracked.

Hey thanks.

Yea, so I figured out the back porting version function thing with <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> (amazing feature) but this is helpful with SpaceDock.

Apparently versions jump from Engine Lighting 1.5 for KSP 1.2.2 to version 1.5.1 for KSP 1.5.1.  Engine Lighting is not available via <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> from what I can tell.  I'm curious if a version exists but is just not readily available for KSP 1.4?  There seems to be info that it is?  

A bit confused and can't help but think it's not available on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> b/c of some of the confusion between versions at the different GitHubs etc.?

Thanks again to whoever can shed some light...

Found a bug a few days ago. I'm running KSP 1.5.1. At night in orbit, engines seem to light up a large area of the surface of the planet. I checked the logs, but there was nothing related to EngineLighting there. It happened with the Mammoth engine, not sure if it happens with other engines.

Here is my mod list: [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bR-gp5K9pMMBarGM23IbkOuTWFKRJULvv64xbh0f9dY/edit?usp=sharing](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1bR-gp5K9pMMBarGM23IbkOuTWFKRJULvv64xbh0f9dY/edit?usp=sharing)

ModuleManager is throwing a simple warning

[WRN 12:47:51.428] [ModuleManager] 1 warning related to GameData/EngineLight/engine-configs.cfg

My correction:

ln88  

-@PART[liquidEngineMini]:smallRadialEngineFOR[EngineLight]  

+@PART[liquidEngineMini&smallRadialEngine]:FOR[EngineLight]
